fields.description:
I would like to be able to trigger a deployment to a particular environment once one of my stages has been completed.

My goal is to create different deploy environments, each with separate permissions, some tied to fully automated build plan stages and others tied to manual stages of the same build plan. 

!https://answers.atlassian.com/download/attachments/11441200/Build%20and%20Deploy.PNG?version=1&modificationDate=1436800566826&api=v2&effects=drop-shadow!

I can see a few reasons for this:

# You want to isolate the 'deployment' tasks from the 'build' tasks. If my deployment to prod fails due to, say, a connectivity issue, that doesn't mean I need to rebuild my binary. Just re-running a deployment should be fine.
# Tag creation and artifact promotion (to name 2) do not belong to deployment. I want to be able to re-run my deployments, roll them back, etc. How should I address the tag creation if I put this task in a deployment environment? Think of re-running deployments, roll-backs, etc.
# I still want to have as much as possible automated, hence I want to deploy to my ENV: Test as soon as I have a green build. I do not want my developers to have to manually create and deploy a release.

Found the following related tickets:

BAM-13347 - Represent deployment triggers as stages within a plan OPEN
BAM-13501 - Authenticate to see issue details

And also logged this question in Atlassian answers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11441200/bamboo-deployment-how-to-trigger-it-without-completing-all-stages
fields.summary: Trigger for deployments on build stage completion

fields.description:
It'd be really nice if we could have some additional notifications at the system level so they could be set for the entire instance (if desired) and would apply to all build plans.  The ones in particular I'd like to have:
-Change of Responsibilities -> Committers
-Failed Builds and First Successful -> Committers

The choices for where to send the notifications would probably have to be limited here, but "committers" is generic enough that it would apply to all builds (in my scenario).
fields.summary: System Notification - Additional Types
Null Pointer Error when configuring Elastic Instance Scheduler

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The following logs appear in the application logs of Bamboo, even when Elastic Bamboo is not in used, nor S3 artifact handlers are in place.
{noformat}
2015-07-15 15:57:31,861 WARN [http-apr-80-exec-56] [S3ArtifactHandlerConfigurator] S3 artifact handler was used, but AWS credentials are missing
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
When running a build plan, or a deployment project, the artifact handlers configuration will be populated in runtime.

h3. Expected Results
This kind of warning does not appear if Elastic Bamboo is not used.

h3. Actual Results
The warnings appear for users that do not have Elastic Bamboo, it's misleading.
fields.summary: "S3 artifact handler was used, but AWS credentials are missing" appears in the logs, but Elastic Bamboo is not configured

fields.description:
*Background*
Currently every time that Bamboo cannot connect to a branch (either branch was deleted or because of a connectivity issue) we log an error in the system logs. Build Engineering reported this is a pain point for them, as these events occur so often that they pollute the logs.
As they are logged under a section called "System Errors" and repetitive, they are misleading to users.

Bamboo logs show:
{noformat}
ERROR [11-BranchDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-19-thread-1] [BranchDetectionServiceImpl] Repository error while detecting branches for plan BUILD-PLAN
{noformat}
{noformat}
INFO [10-BAM::PlanExec:pool-17-thread-1] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Plan 'BUILD-X8' detected that the repository is invalid. The plan will be disabled. : BUILD-X8
{noformat}

The message is generated even if the [Automatic Branch Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+plan+branches#Usingplanbranches-Automaticbranchmanagement] is set to delete Deleted Branches.

*Note:*
As we will be improving the detection of branches deleted, the impact of this issue will be mitigated.

*Proposed Solution:*
Add some filter in the system errors section.
fields.summary: As a Bamboo administrator, I want to be able to filter out warnings in the System Error logs

fields.description:
Currently, Plan Admin permission can administrate all components of the plan including the stages and the plan's permissions.

It would be better to separate the "create/edit stage" privilege from the Plan Admin permission and add it into Plan Edit permission.
fields.summary: Set Create/Edit Stage privilege to be part of Plan Edit Permission

fields.description:
Our guide, [Configuring elastic instances to use EBS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+elastic+instances+to+use+the+EBS], advises users to enable 'legacy EBS handling' for images older than 2 years but doesn't explain why. 

Please provide an explanation for this and how the legacy EBS handling function works. 

Regards,

James Giles IV
Bamboo Support
fields.summary: DOCUMENTATION: Please explain the "legacy EBS handling" function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing build information, the shared artifacts page only displays the actual file name now without showing the RPM version

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to a build
# View the build results summary

h3. Expected Results

The shared artifacts page should show the file names along with RPM versions

h3. Actual Results

The shared artifacts page shows only the file names.
 
h3.Workaround
There is no current workaround
fields.summary: RPM version is no longer seen when switching to S3 storage

fields.description:
Customer's using the Amazon Linux stock image and npm can run into [this bug|https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/6309] in npm which can intermittently cause builds to fail with the error messages indicating package locking.

Example npm errors:
{noformat}npm ERR! EEXIST, open '/home/bamboo/.npm/0af912c6-mboo-npm-json5-0-4-0-package-tgz.lock'
File exists: /home/bamboo/.npm/0af912c6-mboo-npm-json5-0-4-0-package-tgz.lock
Move it away, and try again.
npm ERR! System Linux 3.14.27-25.47.amzn1.x86_64
npm ERR! command "/opt/node-v0.10.35-linux-x64/bin/node" "/opt/node-v0.10.35-linux-x64/bin/npm" "install"
npm ERR! cwd /home/bamboo/bamboo-agent-home/xml-data/build-dir/IW-IW-BBS
npm ERR! node -v v0.10.35
npm ERR! npm -v 1.4.28
npm ERR! path /home/bamboo/.npm/0af912c6-mboo-npm-json5-0-4-0-package-tgz.lock
npm ERR! code EEXIST
npm ERR! errno 47
npm ERR! not ok code 0
:: Task has failed with exit code 47{noformat}

Bug appears to be addressed in npm version 2.1.1.

Per [BAM-14359|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-14359] npm has been updated on the Ubuntu stock image but not the Amazon Linux stock image.
fields.summary: Upgrade npm on Amazon Linux stock AMI

fields.description:
After using Bamboo for a while now, the biggest pain point is the lack of options for displaying code coverage for projects OTHER than Java and Groovy with Atlassian's Clover product. All of our frontend applications use Karma testing that outputs JUnit results, and that's great because any tool that outputs JUnit results can be parsed for Bamboo. What I'm looking for is an option to open up and allow other coverage tools to display a coverage percentage, and Bamboo will parse that out of the logs.

The best example for this is GitLab CI. They don't have a defined coverage tool, they allow you to use whatever you want and have your tool output the coverage percentage to the logs. GitLab CI then parses that out based on a regular expression you can define. It then takes that and displays it. (See screenshot attached to show config interface)

This would make things so much easier so we don't have to check the logs on each build for the coverage percentage. We can then just use our Grunt plugin to run and output coverage percentage, then Bamboo would parse that based on our regular expression we define, then it could send that back in its integration with Stash. (1 Build Passed, 98.72% code coverage)
fields.summary: Allow test coverage parsing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_lha_ command stalls when the command is executed by Bamboo agent.
_lha_ is a compression utility, which is no longer much used except in Japan.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LHA_(file_format)

h3. Environment
* The problem is confirmed to happen on Linux environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare vanilla CentOS 6.4 x64 and install [lha-1.14i-19.2.2.el6.rf.x86_64.rpm|http://pkgs.repoforge.org/lha/lha-1.14i-19.2.2.el6.rf.x86_64.rpm]
# Install Oracle JDK 1.8.0_40 (I believe JDK version does not matter)
# Install Bamboo 5.9.2
# Create a project and plan
# Add a task with 'script' task type, and put the following script in the scriptbody:
{code}
#/bin/bash
rm -fr /tmp/*
echo aaaaa > /tmp/test.txt
/usr/bin/lha aq /tmp/test.lzh /tmp/test.txt
rm -f /tmp/test.txt
/usr/bin/lha xfqw=/tmp /tmp/test.lzh      # this command becomes stalled
{code}
# Run the plan, which ends to be stalled

h3. Expected Results
The command finishes without stalling

h3. Actual Results
The command stalls. You cannot see any error log.

h3. Notes
- The script can be run without failure if we run it manually from terminal or if using Jenkins
- The _lha_ command seems to be stalled with waiting any input from 0 (standard input) when I run strace on the process
{noformat}
# ps auxww | grep lha
root      3106  0.0  0.0   4148   488 pts/0    S    13:22   0:00 /usr/bin/lha xfqw=/tmp /tmp/test.lzh
root      3112  0.0  0.0 103212   812 pts/0    S+   13:22   0:00 grep lha
# strace -p 3106
Process 3106 attached - interrupt to quit
read(0,
{noformat}
- It seems that Bamboo agent associates 0 (standard input) to pipe
{noformat}
# ls -l /proc/3106/fd
total 0
lr-x------ 1 root root 64 Jul 13 12:42 0 -> pipe:[28643]
l-wx------ 1 root root 64 Jul 13 12:42 1 -> pipe:[28644]
l-wx------ 1 root root 64 Jul 13 12:42 2 -> pipe:[28645]
{noformat}


h3.Workaround
- The command is not stalled if you change the last line of the script to this:
bq. /usr/bin/lha xfqw=/tmp /tmp/test.lzh 0>/dev/random
fields.summary: lha command stalls
Bamboo Maven Tasks Plugin does not support Maven 3.3+ on Windows

fields.description:
h4. Improvement

It would be useful to implement an audit log for image configurations to see when and possibly what was changed in the event of a failure.
fields.summary: Add audit log to image configuration page
Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes

fields.description:
On a JIRA dashboard that contains the Clover Coverage gadget, if the 'Use my favourite plans' option is selected, the gadget says 'No plans selected.' even though there are favourite plans on Bamboo.

*Workaround:*
Edit the gadget, uncheck the 'Use my favourite plans' option and manually add the plans.
fields.summary: Clover Coverage gadget doesn't work if favourite plan option is selected

fields.description: Many organizations, like mine, use Slack (http://www.slack.com) for team-related communications. Slack has an awesome API for receiving POSTs. We should be able to add Slack as a notification recipient, possibly by allowing the user to configure endpoints under Bamboo Configuration (perhaps under the Communications tab). This way when builds hang or jobs succeed for the first time, whatever the organization requires, it can simply output that information in the Slack channel that the user configures.
fields.summary: Add Slack notfiications to Build and Deploy Plan Notification Recipients list on Cloud

fields.description:
Hi,

if got a problem with the parser, if there is a "." in the arguments.

This string seems to be searched for last occurrence of a point. This is actual wrong if there are method arguments of the decimal type. The index search for the displayed name should only be done till the first occurrence of a brace.

Example:

Namespace.SampleClass.SampleMethod(0.024m,1.2m,1.176m,58.8m)

The current parser extracts:

This page summarises information for 8m) in test class 176m,58.

But it should the "... for SampleMethod in test class SampleClass ..."
fields.summary: Problem with parsing NUnit-Testresult

fields.description:
I have a build that currently looks like this:

!Screen Shot 2015-07-10 at 8.52.36 am.png!

Sometimes I want to be able to say:

{quote}If the first stage succeeds then automatically run the manual stage.{quote} 

However, currently, I have to wait until the first stage finishes before I can manually trigger the next stage. This hampers dev speed. It would be great if you could hit the play button in advance and it would conditionally run the next stage if the previous one succeeded (just like normal).
fields.summary: Allow manual stages to be triggered before the previous stages have finished.

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Bamboo Cloud artifact download task cannot retrieve previously created Atlassian Cloud stored artifacts when S3 is configured for artifact storage. 

h4. Duplication Steps
(i) With artifact storage configuration set to Atlassian Cloud
# Run build generating simple artifact
# Create a release from the build
# Run a simple deploy adding the artifact download task
# Change artifact storage configuration to S3
# Run deploy
(i) artifact cannot be found as the artifact download task only searches for the currently configured artifact storage method. 

h4. Expected behavior
Bamboo artifact download task should know when the artifact is stored in Atlassian Cloud or S3

h4. Actual behaviour
The following error is shown on the build log:
{noformat}

	Starting task 'Download release' of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-artifact-downloader-plugin:artifactdownloadertask'
	Preparing to download plan result PLAN-5 artifact: Shared artifact: [Artifact Name], pattern: [**/*.jar]
	Unable to download artifact Shared artifact: [Artifact Name], pattern: [**/*.jar]
	Task configuration:
	artifactId_0 -> [-1]
	sourcePlanKey -> [PLAN]
	localPath_0 -> [target]
	Task runtime configuration:
	securityToken -> [763bbd456c413486805048b9ba8b873562c992eb96573b3]
	runtimeArtifactIds_0 -> [0]
	artifactName_0 -> [Artifact Name]
	artifactId_0 -> [8338832]
	resultKey -> [PLAN-5]
	artifactLocation_0 -> []
	localPath_0 -> [target]
	artifactPattern_0 -> [**/*.jar]
	Finished task 'Download release' with result: Error
	Finalising the build...
{noformat}
Switching to Server Storage and running the deployment again works as expected.

h4. Workaround
Trigger new build to generate artifacts under the currently used artifact storage configuration
fields.summary: Artifact download task only respects current stored artifacts configuration

fields.description:
Bulk edit plan permissions are failing when group name inherited from JIRA/Crowd has blank spaces.

h5. Problem

It's currently not possible to create groups in Bamboo with blank spaces in the name (e.g. Atlassian Support Group). Thus we would have to create a group named _atlassian-support-group_ instead. However, this is not true for other applications like JIRA/Crowd, where it is possible to create groups with blank spaces in their names.

Problem happens when you have Bamboo using JIRA/Crowd as a user repository: [Integrating Bamboo with Crowd|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd]. When you are connecting Bamboo to an external user management system, users and groups are no longer coming from Bamboo. Therefore, when Bamboo gets sync'ed with JIRA/Crowd it pulls the groups with blank spaces in their names.

h5. Steps to reproduce

# Set up Bamboo to use *Users and groups from JIRA or Crowd*: [Integrating Bamboo with Crowd|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd].
# Add a user to a group with blank spaces in its name (e.g. Atlassian Support Group).
# Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Bulk edit plan permissions}}.
# Select a plan which you want to bulk edit permissions.
# Set the *"Grant permission to"* field to *"Group"*.
# Select the group with blank spaces in the name (e.g. Atlassian Support Group).
# Give the group one of the available permissions (e.g. View, Edit, Build, Clone or Admin).
# Hit the _Next_ button.
# The following error will be displayed:
!bulk-edit-plan-permissions.png!

h5. Workaround

Instead of going to the {{Bulk edit plan permissions}} page, access the {{Plan Configuration >> Permissions}} page of the plan you're trying to edit permissions, and manually add the group/permissions in that page. That does not trigger any errors and the group is added to the plan's permissions.
fields.summary: Bulk edit plan permissions fails when group\user name has blank spaces

fields.description:
1. Create a Bamboo build that builds for both develop and feature/XYZ
2. Enable git submodule support for the repo in Bamboo
3. Create a feature/XYZ branch in your repo and add a new submodule
4. Bamboo builds feature/XYZ but fails because the Git submodule folder is empty (it's contents are not cloned)

There are couple of ways this can be solved:

A. If submodules are enabled for the repo, Bamboo should make sure to initialise & update all submodules after switching branches 
B. Bamboo can clone down the branch directly with both --branch and --recursive flags, this will make sure the submodules for that branch are initialized and cloned
fields.summary: Git Submodules not cloned if not present on default branch

fields.description:
The Bamboo installation guides are not consistent. Although the one for [Mac|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Installing+Bamboo+on+Mac+OS+X] and [Windows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Installing+Bamboo+on+Windows] specify the latest Java version requirement:
bq. The version of Java should be 1.8.x. Note that Bamboo requires the Java JDK to work, not the Java JRE.
The [same for Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Installing+Bamboo+on+Linux] in the latest documentation is still:
bq. The version of Java should be 1.6.0 or 1.7.x.
fields.summary: Documentation request: Java version in install guide

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Set up a linked git repo with submodules, and tick the _Use submodules_ box
* Set up a plan that clones that repo
* Enable branches in that plan, and create a branch in Bamboo

You will see, in the branch repository settings, the _Use submodules_ option is enabled. In spite of that, when the branch repo is cloned, *submodules are ignored*.

Tried with 2 different versions of Bamboo, using both ssh and http for the git repo, same results.
fields.summary: Plans with git submodules ignore them in branches

fields.description:
A user configured a repository with 'Fetch whole repository' on, so that he could get all branches and not just the one he is checking out from. This is because  he wants to checkout another branch as part of  build plan 

h5. When using a local agent
No matter if 'Fetch whole' is on or not, the output is same when doing _git branch --all_: It just have remote branches.
{noformat}
remotes/origin/HEAD -> origin/master
02-Jul-2015 07:46:50	  remotes/origin/branchA
02-Jul-2015 07:46:50	  remotes/origin/branchB
02-Jul-2015 07:46:50	  remotes/origin/master
{noformat}

h5. When running on a remote agent
- If we're not fetching all - I just have the local.
{noformat}
Fetching 'refs/heads/master' from 'https://bitbucket.org/user/dummy-repo'.
02-Jul-2015 07:45:15	* master
{noformat}

- If fetching all - all the branches are local.
{noformat}
Fetching 'refs/heads/*' from 'https://bitbucket.org/user/dummy-repo'.
02-Jul-2015 07:35:03	  branchA
02-Jul-2015 07:35:03	  branchB
02-Jul-2015 07:35:03	* master
{noformat}

We should either improve the UI/UX so that its clear that fetch whole repository does not extend to local agents OR make the feature available to local agents as well
fields.summary: Fetch whole repository should work on local agents
Bamboo password encryption/import process causes password strings to exceed DB imposed character limits

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The built-in Builds workflow in JIRA Cloud does not transition issues when builds complete or fail. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud Only
* Using the Builds Workflow (built-in or customized)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new JIRA project
# Associate the  Builds workflow with the project
# Create a new Issue (EX-1)
# Create a Bamboo plan with some tasks in it and set it to auto poll.
# Create a repository and link it with both JIRA and the Bamboo Plan
# Create a commit with the following commit message: {{EX-1 #wait #comment Test}}}
** The Issue will automatically be transitions to 'Building' in JIRA. Your plan will start a build linked to the JIRA Issue
# The build will either Fail or Pass

h3. Expected Results
The Issue EX-1 should transition to Build Passed or Build Failed after the build is complete.
h3. Actual Results
The Issue EX-1 remains in the 'Building' Workflow step.

h3.Workaround
No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: Builds workflow doesn't transition properly

fields.description:
*As a User I want to trigger Bamboo plans on new commits in my VCS and be able to learn about their result.*

Currently Bamboo offers a generic REST API Endpoint {{BAMBO_URL/updateAndBuild.action?buildKey=PLAN-KEY}} which can be used to trigger the build of affected branches (i.e. {{PLAN-KEY13}}). If it is a new branch this trigger will do nothing at first, but the automatic branch detection will setup a new branch plan (ie. {{PLAN-KEY32}}) and start it automatically.

The current rest API does not offer any means to find out about the status and/or result of this call. *As User I do know about the VCS revision number which triggered my build* (i.e. Git Hash oder Subversion Commit Number). But I do not know anything about the associated Bamboo Branch Plan as those are managed by Bamboo itself.

[Gitlab tried to use the labelling feature|http://doc.gitlab.com/ce/project_services/bamboo.html] to circumvent this, but this seems to have stopped working because the REST API no longer allows to search for branch results by label.

Bamboo should offer a REST API Endpoint which allows to query the plan results associated with a given VCS Revision Number. Or at least allow to query branch plan results by label.
fields.summary: Bamboo REST API: Means to find out about the (branch) result triggered by a commit

fields.description:
Audit log does show when a server capability is added or removed:
"Server Capability added"
"Server Capability removed"

Audit log does show when an agent specific capability is added or removed:
"Capability added to Agent Default Agent"
"Capability removed from Agent Default Agent"

Audit log does show when a remote agent specific capability is added or removed:
"Added shared Remote capability"
"Removed shared Remote capability"

However, when any of these capabilities are edited, nothing is logged.
fields.summary: Audit log doesn't record server or agent capability edits

fields.description:
In some pages, Bamboo shows the authors of commits, even if they're not local users. If their not associated with a user, they are shown like this:
!branch_author.png|thumbnail!

We can see if follows this patterns:
Display name <user@domain.com>

When clicking this user, we get this 'Internal Server Error Page':
!error_page.png|thumbnail!

The following stacktrace is shown:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Dangerous string detected: /builds//authors/viewAuthor.action?authorName=unknown <user@domain.com>
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.util.RequestCacheThreadLocal.assertNoXss(RequestCacheThreadLocal.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.util.RequestCacheThreadLocal.putHttpRequest(RequestCacheThreadLocal.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.util.RequestCacheThreadLocal.setRequestCache(RequestCacheThreadLocal.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.filter.RequestCacheThreadLocalFilter.doFilter(RequestCacheThreadLocalFilter.java:31)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.core.filters.HeaderSanitisingFilter.doFilter(HeaderSanitisingFilter.java:32)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter$1.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:70)
{noformat}

Since it says it's a 'Dangerous string detected', it seems that the URL is the problem. The accessed URL is as follows:
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/builds/browse/author/Display%20Name%20<user@domain.com>
{noformat}

We can see that the URL contains the '<' and '>' characters. Maybe these are badly interpreted by Bamboo.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Have a plan connected to a repository in Bamboo
# Commit to the repository with a user that doesn't exist in Bamboo (and not associated with any), the plan will run a build
# This user will appear in may pages in Bamboo as the commit author (it will have a '<' and '>' in its name), you can find it in the build page under 'Commits' for example. Once found, click it

*Expected Behavior*
* Either some information about the user is shown or a message saying it doesn't exist in Bamboo

*Actual Behavior*
* An Internal Server Error Page is shown
fields.summary: Clicking on a commit author's name when it's not connected to a user is causing an error page

fields.description:
In some cases, some Bamboo builds have been failing because Bamboo is attempting to connected to the 'master' branch in some repository, but instead it looks for 'default'. 

When this branch doesn't exist, the build fails to run.

The logs show the following errors:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.InvalidRepositoryException: Cannot determine head revision of 'https://bitbucket.org/witech2/wipod' on branch 'default'. Branch has probably been removed.
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.trigger.DefaultChangeDetectionManager.collectChangesSinceLastBuildInternal(DefaultChangeDetectionManager.java:444)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.trigger.DefaultChangeDetectionManager.collectChangesSinceRevisions(DefaultChangeDetectionManager.java:301)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.trigger.DefaultChangeDetectionManager.collectChangesSinceRevisions(DefaultChangeDetectionManager.java:186)

	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.trigger.ChangeDetectionListenerAction.testIfBuildShouldStart(ChangeDetectionListenerAction.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanExecutionManagerImpl$4.call(PlanExecutionManagerImpl.java:526)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanExecutionManagerImpl$4.call(PlanExecutionManagerImpl.java:510)

	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanExecutionLockServiceImpl.lock(PlanExecutionLockServiceImpl.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanExecutionManagerImpl.doWithProcessLock(PlanExecutionManagerImpl.java:800)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanExecutionManagerImpl.startConditionalBuild(PlanExecutionManagerImpl.java:509)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanExecutionManagerImpl.start(PlanExecutionManagerImpl.java:582)
...
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.InvalidRepositoryException: Cannot determine head revision of 'https://bitbucket.org/witech2/wipod' on branch 'default'. Branch has probably been removed.
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.rerun(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.runTask(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.retry(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:191)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.InvalidRepositoryException: Cannot determine head revision of 'https://bitbucket.org/witech2/wipod' on branch 'default'. Branch has probably been removed.
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.NativeGitOperationHelper.obtainLatestRevision(NativeGitOperationHelper.java:550)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.NativeGitOperationHelper$2.call(NativeGitOperationHelper.java:561)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.NativeGitOperationHelper$2.call(NativeGitOperationHelper.java:557)
{noformat}

Another behavior we could see in a case, when selecting the repository in the Linked Repositories page in Bamboo, right when it's select the 'Branch' is 'default' and it's immediately changed to 'master'.

*Workaround*
# Delete the repository and add it back
fields.summary: Build fails to run because Bamboo attempts to connect to 'default' branch (non-existent) instead of 'master'

fields.description: Request for support of [Microsoft Edge Browser|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/browser-for-doing] in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Support Microsoft Edge browser

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Launch Stash on 7990 and Bamboo on 8085 on the same machine
# Set Bamboo base URL to {{http://localhost:8085/bamboo}}
# Initiate applink from Stash using {{http://127.0.0.1:8085/bamboo}}. Applink prompts that the application URL is different, continue
# Setup a Stash linked repo with a build plan using Stash commit triggered
# Commit and push a change to Stash

h5. Observed behavior
Build is not started, {{BranchChangedEventListener}} is not seen in logs

h5. Workaround
# Change the Base URL in Bamboo to the application URL used (proxy bypass address)
# Initiate applink, application URL and display URL should be the same
# Modify Bamboo display URL to the public URL in Stash applink
# Revert the base URL back to the public facing URL in Bamboo
fields.summary: Stash triggers does not work if Base URL is different than Application URL when creating applinks

fields.description:
Sometimes; errors displayed on Bamboo UI is not accurate. It will be great if the errors shown on Bamboo log will also be displayed or retrievable by the user so that they know what is going wrong. In Bamboo Server; logs can be retrieved by the user but not retrievable at Bamboo Cloud.

In the case of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16109 where the error is related to Bamboo key pair; if the Bamboo log is made known to the user; they would have figured out that this is caused by the key pair.
fields.summary: A way to show Bamboo log errors for customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a SSH key to a remote machine it sometimes hangs when using a certain combination of commands on the remote host.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SSH task
# On the commands define something like that:
{noformat}
sudo su - user
ls /tools/eai/stage
tname=`ls /tools/eai/stage/deployagent*-bin.tar.gz`
echo $tname
cd /tools/eai/scripts/deployagent
rm -vrf * > /dev/null/ 2>&1
tar xvf $tname > /dev/null 2>&1
rm $tname > /dev/null 2>&1
{noformat}
# Run the build

h3. Expected Results

Task runs, commands run and finish and the build either succeeds or fails.

h3. Actual Results

The build hangs and spins indefinitely.

h3.Workaround

Wrap the commands above inside a script and run it like:
{noformat}
nohup ./yourscript.sh </dev/null>/dev/null 2>&1 &
{noformat}
fields.summary: SSH task sometimes hangs when using sudo su - user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When previewing a deployment in Bamboo the deployment differences when comparing a branch that's merged to the currently deployed branch you current see the following message as a difference:

{quote}
The release currently deployed on this environment is from a different branch. The difference cannot be calculated.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution

The difference should show the number of issues and commits that differ between the merged branch and the current deployment, as the code base has the same origins.
fields.summary: On the deployment preview page when changing to a branch merged with current deployment difference should be shown

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While toggling between plan branches on the deployment preview page the differences panel shows inconsistent results. For the one plan it can sometimes show the x number of issues and commits different, and sometimes it will show the 'difference cannot be calculated message'.

h3. Environment
* 5.10-OD-1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up in bitbucket a repository with 2 branches as well as the master branch. One branch should be merged with master, i.e. identical code, the second branch should be different to master. Run builds from all of those branches.
# Set up a deployment pointing at that plan and run a deployment over master.
# Go to Deploy -> All Deployment Projects -> deployment from step 2 -> <deploy action button> -> Deployment Preview
# Change from the 'master' plan branch to the branch with identical code to master, take note of the 'difference' panel
# Change to the branch with different code to master, take note of the 'difference' panel
# Change back to the branch with the same code as master

h3. Expected Results

The difference panel should say the same thing as in step 4.

h3. Actual Results

The results are extremely inconsistent, in step 4 occasionally the differences are shown as x number of issues and x number of commits (took me about 20 attempts to make it appear, but in some cases it appears every time), on other occasions it's shown as the following message:
{quote}
The release currently deployed on this environment is from a different branch. The difference cannot be calculated.
{quote}
In step 5 and step 6 though it is pretty consistently displayed as the 'cannot be calculated message'. This causes a significant amount of confusion if in step 4 you see how many issues and commits are different and then in step 6 when it should say the same thing it doesn't.
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: When changing the plan branch on the development preview page inconsistent differences are displayed

fields.description: I would like to request that the code in deploymentVersionDecorator.ftl be refactored to use the web-item logic in so many other places in bamboo. This would allow me to write a plugin using the existing [web item plugin methodology| https://developer.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOODEV/Web+Item+Module] to add a new tab to the Release specific actions.
fields.summary: Refactoring of tabs for submenu in releases

fields.description:
When starting a new instance Bamboo displays the message:
*Failed to start elastic instances: Error when starting a new instance*

*Cause:*
Bamboo no longer automatically creates key pair.

The following error appears in the log:
{noformat}
2015-07-02 10:28:49.679017500 2015-07-02 10:28:49,678 INFO [scheduler_Worker-2] [ElasticRunningInstancesOptimizerImpl] AWS account has 0 elastic instances started by Bamboo server(s) and has 0 spot requests pending, 0 in total. Of these, Bamboo controls 0.
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102443500 2015-07-02 10:28:50,102 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-2] [ElasticInstancesMonitorJob] Failed to adjust the number of elastic agents.
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102445500 com.atlassian.aws.AWSException: Error when starting a new instance
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102445500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.server.ElasticFunctionalityFacadeImpl.startupAgents(ElasticFunctionalityFacadeImpl.java:218)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102446500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.schedule.ElasticInstancesMonitorJob.execute(ElasticInstancesMonitorJob.java:50)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102452500 	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:202)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102452500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooRunnables$1.run(BambooRunnables.java:49)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102453500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWith(ImpersonationHelper.java:31)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102453500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWithSystemAuthority(ImpersonationHelper.java:20)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102454500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper$1.run(ImpersonationHelper.java:52)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102455500 	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:525)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102455500 Caused by: com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException: The key pair 'elasticbamboo' does not exist (Service: AmazonEC2; Status Code: 400; Error Code: InvalidKeyPair.NotFound; Request ID: 662XXXX-1a90-XXXX-b2fe-565XXXXXXba)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102458500 	at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.handleErrorResponse(AmazonHttpClient.java:1077)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102459500 	at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeOneRequest(AmazonHttpClient.java:725)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102459500 	at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeHelper(AmazonHttpClient.java:460)
2015-07-02 10:28:50.102461500 	at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.execute(AmazonHttpClient.java:295)
{noformat}

*Workaround:*
Manually create the keypair with name "elasticbamboo" in the AWS console for the region that your elastic instances are configured to start up in. Keep the private key file as Bamboo won't have it on server side.
[Obtaining AWS Key Pair to access Amazon Elastic Instances|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Obtaining+AWS+Key+Pair+to+access+Amazon+Elastic+Instances]
More info on [Amazon EC2 Key Pairs|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-key-pairs.html#having-ec2-create-your-key-pair]

*Update:*
A fix is in testing stage and should be released soon to Bamboo Cloud.
fields.summary: Bamboo Failed to start elastic instances: Error when starting a new instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Navigating back to the deployment preview page in Bamboo does not recall all field states properly, it recalls the branch field but not the build result or the release. The Branch field is also showing one value but actually 

h3. Environment

* Bamboo Cloud 5.10-OD-1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a deployment set up with branches and JIRA issues committed to the bitbucket repo
# Deploy -> All Deployment Projects -> deployment from step 1 -> <deploy action button> -> Deployment Preview
# Click the 'Create new release from build result' radio button
# Select a plan branch from the drop down (that's not master)
# Click the build number under the 'Artifacts provided by' text on the right
# Wait for the page to load
# Click back

h3. Expected Results

The same plan branch selected in step 4 above will be selected and the same build result and release will be selected. On the right you'll also see the same preview as you saw after step 4.

h3. Actual Results

The radio button will default to 'Promote existing release to this environment'
If you then click the 'Create new release from build result' you'll see
* The plan branch will be retained
* The build result will be the latest build from the master branch
* The release will be the latest release from the master branch
* If you click 'Start Deployment' it will actually build the latest build result from the master branch despite claiming that a different plan branch is selected.
 
h3.Workaround

The deployment preview page is in a broken state, so hard refreshing the page will restore it back to an expected state.
fields.summary: Click back to deployment preview page recalls some field states and not others

fields.description:
It would be nice if Bamboo could specify a different instance type to fall back to if the selected spot instance type is unavailable or goes out of price range.

This would allow for budget constrained building. An example would be when a client wants to build on the most powerful instance possible for x dollars. If no spot instances are available to satisfy this then Bamboo could fall back to a smaller (cheaper) instance type automatically.
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo spot instance fallback to be configurable

fields.description:
Two perceivably different features that should not affect each other are interacting in a strange way.

Verified on 5.8, 5.9, 5.10 OD instances

h2. Steps to reproduce
1. Have 
-- a user with global permission Restricted admin
-- XSRF protection enabled on instance
2. Disable XSRF protection in UI>Security settings
3. Discover restricted admin user no longer has that permission

h3. Expected
Global permissions should not be affected by the global security setting change

h3. Actual
Restricted admin permission is removed from user, see screenshots before/after

h2. Verify security behaviour
[~kbrazulewicz], [~dblack] can any of you confirm that this is NOT by design because of the security aspects of this issue?
fields.summary: Restricted admin permission is removed from users when disabling XSRF protection

fields.description: Currently there is no way for users to subscribe to software update notifications within the Bamboo application. The current options of subscribing to the [DevTools Blog|http://blogs.atlassian.com/blog-cat/dev-tools/] or [Bamboo release page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+releases] should be refined. As the release page only covers major releases and the devtools blog might be a bit irrelevant for this purpose which at the time of creating this ticket did not include any information about the Bamboo 5.9.1 release on the 24th of June.
fields.summary: Add a method where admins can subscribe to software notification updates within the application

fields.description:
h4. Problem:
In the Universal Plugin Manager (version 2.18.5) it shows Bamboo 5.9.1 being available in the drop down when Bamboo 5.9.1 is installed. Displaying the following message:
{quote}
*Version 5.9.1 of Bamboo has just been released!* Since 5.9.1 is new, there may be add-ons listed here as incompatible that actually are compatible, but not yet tested by their authors. We recommend contacting the add-on authors to check and update their compatibility information for the Bamboo 5.9.1 Atlassian Marketplace.
{quote}

This can cause confusion as this message can cause some to think that 5.9.1 is not currently installed and attempt to install it again. 

h4. Expected Behavior:
The UPM should display Bamboo as being on the most current version (if up to date) as well as incompatible plugins installed with this version.
fields.summary: Universal Plugin Manager shows Bamboo 5.9.1 available when 5.9.1 is already installed

fields.description: In some cases client scripts will put out their own timestamps, line numbers for further sorting, etc. It would be awesome to control the output of timestamps at a plan/job/task level to accommodate these use cases.
fields.summary: Add flag to disable build timestamps

fields.description:
It causes nextBuildNumber being (re)set incorrectly to 1. 
What we should do is to move first/last/next buildNumber from BUILD into its own table.
fields.summary: Race between linking branch to JIRA issue and triggering initial build causing subsequent build to fail

fields.description:
Instead of creating multiple linked repository for multiple branches, Bamboo should allow selection of checkout branch at plan level in the main plan configuration.

Branch plan may not be an option for configurations that have a separate task list for different branches
fields.summary: Allow branch selection of a linked repository in a plan

fields.description: It is throwing an error, PFA screen shot.
fields.summary: Not able to stop the old build that were failing on 29th June

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upgrading Bamboo to 5.8.1 with an older database can lead to Bamboo not creating the {{CREDENTIALS}} table. However, Bamboo will successfully start but not flag any errors at the UI level. 

Customers who try to create a new Git repository will be presented with the standard new repository dialog box - but no pull down field to specify the Authentication type will be presented as we can't refer to the table in the DB. 

This same issue causes further problems when upgrading to 5.9.x with upgrade task {{5907 : Update SSH credentials configuration}}

h3. Environment
* Prominently occurs on Microsoft SQL Server however may also occur on other DBMS due to case-sensitivity configuration.

h3. Expected Results
{{CREDENTIALS}} Table should have been created by the schema update.

h3. Actual Results
Below exception is shown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}}:
{noformat}
2017-07-12 13:46:35,908 INFO [13-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-28-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -------------------------------------------
2017-07-12 13:46:35,908 INFO [13-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-28-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 5907 : Update SSH credentials configuration
2017-07-12 13:46:35,908 INFO [13-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-28-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -------------------------------------------
2017-07-12 13:46:35,923 WARN [13-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-28-thread-1] [JDBCExceptionReporter] SQL Error: 208, SQLState: S0002
2017-07-12 13:46:35,923 ERROR [13-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-28-thread-1] [JDBCExceptionReporter] Invalid object name 'CREDENTIALS'.
2017-07-12 13:46:35,923 ERROR [13-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-28-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] org.springframework.dao.InvalidDataAccessResourceUsageException: could not execute query; SQL [select this_.CREDENTIALS_ID as CREDENTI1_89_0_, this_.PLUGIN_KEY as PLUGIN2_89_0_, this_.NAME as NAME89_0_, this_.XML as XML89_0_ from CREDENTIALS this_]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.SQLGrammarException: could not execute query
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.SessionFactoryUtils.convertHibernateAccessException(SessionFactoryUtils.java:642)
....
com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v5_9.UpgradeTask5907UpdateSshCredentialsConfiguration.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask5907UpdateSshCredentialsConfiguration.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.runUpgradeTask(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:206)
...
Caused by: org.hibernate.exception.SQLGrammarException: could not execute query
	at org.hibernate.exception.SQLStateConverter.convert(SQLStateConverter.java:92)
	at org.hibernate.exception.JDBCExceptionHelper.convert(JDBCExceptionHelper.java:66)
...
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'CREDENTIALS'.
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:372)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2894)
...
{noformat}

Schema update failed to alter the table as it didn't exist:
{noformat}
2017-07-12 13:46:15,408 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [UpgradeLauncher] Checking if schema update is required...
alter table CREDENTIALS add CREDENTIALS_ID numeric(19,0) not null
2017-07-12 13:46:16,344 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: alter table CREDENTIALS add CREDENTIALS_ID numeric(19,0) not null
2017-07-12 13:46:16,344 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [SchemaUpdate] Cannot find the object "CREDENTIALS" because it does not exist or you do not have permissions.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
# Stop Bamboo 
# (!) Backup your Bamboo database and *<bamboo-home>* for rollback purposes
# Create the table manually with the below example SQL (MS SQL):
{code}
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[CREDENTIALS]
(
    [CREDENTIALS_ID] [numeric](19, 0) NOT NULL,
    [NAME] [nvarchar](255) NULL,
    [XML] [ntext] NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (	[CREDENTIALS_ID] ASC) WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, 
    STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, 
    ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON) ON [PRIMARY]
) ON [PRIMARY] TEXTIMAGE_ON [PRIMARY]
{code}
# Start Bamboo

Or:
# Stop Bamboo
# (!) Backup your Bamboo database and *<bamboo-home>* for rollback purposes
# Set the system property using [Configuring your system properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/configuring-your-system-properties-289277345.html] to make Bamboo recreate its schema:
{{-Datlassian.forceSchemaUpdate=true}}
# Restart Bamboo
fields.summary: Invalid object name CREDENTIALS when upgrading Bamboo or creating repositories

fields.summary: Cannot run any builds - Bamboo OnDemand

fields.description: Upgrade an Bamboo 5.9 instance to Bamboo 5.9.1. In the "Manage Add-ons" section run the "Bamboo Update Check".  UPM (v2.16.2) will incorrectly offer 5.9.1 as an option to validate against, even though Bamboo is already at that version.
fields.summary: Current version is still offered as an upgrade when on that version

fields.description:
h4. Problem: 
Plan branches are added for disabled plans

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Configure Bamboo to use a linked repository to Stash
# In Stash, pull requests to require 1 approver and 1 successful build
# Create a build plan in which the option "Automatically manage branches" is checked
# Clone this build plan 
# Disable the cloned build plan.
# Make a commit on a new branch

Both build plans get branch plans created for them, even the disabled on. The build on the disabled plan fails. Stash then sees both a passing build in the original plan and a failed build in the disabled cloned plan. Now Stash will not let the merge go process as it sees the failed build in the disabled plan as not meeting the requirement to allow the pull request to be merged as Stash seems to require a passing build in all plans where the branch build might occur.

h4. Expected Behavior:
The desired behavior is that if the overall plan is disabled, it should not allow automatic branch plans to obtain the branch unless manually added.

h4. Workaround:
Disable all the individual branch plans or delete the disabled plan.
fields.summary: Branches still added when plan is disabled

fields.description:
Running customized builds is showing this page:
!broken_build_customized.png|thumbnail!

This page is broken, as it should be in a pop up window, in a fancy UI and with only one 'run' button as shown below:
!build_run_customized.png|thumbnail!

This seems to be affecting some instances since last update.

*Steps to Replicated*
# Go to a plan
# Click 'Run customized...'

*Expected behavior*
* Fancy pop up window with one 'run' button

*Actual behavior*
* Broken page

h2. Incident Progress:
We have identified the cause of the problem and are working on a rollout of the fix to affected instances in the following hours.

h2. Other Problems related to this Upgrade with the same root cause:
[BAM-16080 - XSRF filter causing 500 error when triggering builds or changing filters in Bamboo 5.10-OD-01-004|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16080]
[BAM-16081 - Bamboo Builds and Deployments sections showing UI problems after upgrade|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16081]
[BAM-16090 - The "Create a new plan" screen is broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16090]
[BAM-16092 - Triggers page seems to be broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16092]
fields.summary: Option to run customized builds in Bamboo is taking to a broken page

fields.description:
After latest upgrade, trigger pages seem to be broken.

This is what they used to and should look like:
!old_trigger.png|thumbnail!

Notice that the trigger information is in the right corner and the 'Trigger' tab is selected.

Now, this is what we see on selecting the trigger:
!new_trigger.png|thumbnail!

The trigger tab is not selected and the trigger page information is taking all space within the panel.

Adding triggers is also showing a broken page, sometimes preventing users to set configuration and create the trigger correctly. 

This is how is used to look like:
!create_trigger_working.png|thumbnail!

To create a scheduled trigger now, we see:
!create_trigger.png|thumbnail!

Notice you cannot set a time there. This was only tested with 'scheduled' triggers, but may be happening to others.

*Steps to replicated*
# Viewing trigger
#* Configure a plan
#* Click the 'Triggers' tab
#* Click a trigger
# Viewing scheduled trigger
#* Configure a plan
#* Click the 'Triggers' tab
#* Click 'Add Trigger' >> Scheduled

*Expected behavior*
* Trigger on the right panel is shown with 'Trigger' tab selected
* You can configure everything on creating the trigger

Actual behavior*
* The trigger information take whole panel and tab is not selected
* Sometimes unable to set configuration when creating the trigger

h2. Incident Progress:
We have identified the cause of the problem and are working on a rollout of the fix to affected instances in the following hours.

h2. Other Problems related to this Upgrade with the same root cause:
[BAM-16080 - XSRF filter causing 500 error when triggering builds or changing filters in Bamboo 5.10-OD-01-004|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16080]
[BAM-16081 - Bamboo Builds and Deployments sections showing UI problems after upgrade|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16081]
[BAM-16090 - The "Create a new plan" screen is broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16090]
[BAM-16093 - Option to run customized builds in Bamboo is taking to a broken page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16093]
fields.summary: Triggers page seems to be broken

fields.description: If the _Build Dashboard_ has more than 50 plans a _Show more plans_ button appear for you to be able to display more plans. However, clicking on it doesn't produce any results (no new plans are displayed as they should), and the browser's development tools show many errors.
fields.summary: The "Show more plans" button doesn't work

fields.description:
When creating a new plan the _Create a new plan_ screen isn't behaving as it should.
Some of the issues are displayed below:

# If the _New project_ option is selected on the _Project_ drop-down list, the fields for you to name the new project don't appear (they appear after you click the _Configure plan_ button at the bottom saying the fields are required)
# When the new project and plan name are insert on their respective fields both the project key and plan key fields aren't automatically populated as they should.
# It's not possible to configure a repository at all with either of the two options (previous linked or new repository)

h2. Incident Progress:
We have identified the cause of the problem and are working on a rollout of the fix to affected instances in the following hours.

h2. Other Problems related to this Upgrade with the same root cause:
[BAM-16080 - XSRF filter causing 500 error when triggering builds or changing filters in Bamboo 5.10-OD-01-004|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16080]
[BAM-16081 - Bamboo Builds and Deployments sections showing UI problems after upgrade|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16081]
[BAM-16092 - Triggers page seems to be broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16092]
[BAM-16093 - Option to run customized builds in Bamboo is taking to a broken page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16093]
fields.summary: The "Create a new plan" screen is broken

fields.description:

fields.summary: Running builds and parts of the UI are broken on Bamboo Cloud with JDK6

fields.description:
BLOCKER:  Linked to BAM-16081, we are unable to create build.  Was told to open a ticket to get a fix deployed to our instance immediatly.

Thanks,

TL
fields.summary: BAM-16081 - cannot run builds or edit tasks.

fields.description:
Running into strangeness trying to run a build plan. First encountered this message:

(java.lang.RuntimeException : Could not generate next build number for 'MCSCIAPI-MCSCIAPISYSTEMRELEASEBUILD70')

So I deleted the branch I was trying to run. Now, it will not allow me to manually create a branch, nor does it bring up the dialog box with available branches in Bitbucket.

The attached screen print describes what I see instead of a dialog box.

I realize there is an issue with a recent upgrade. Just wanted to make sure this issue was addressed as well.
fields.summary: Bamboo fails to load/create branches in plan

fields.description: auviknetworks.atlassian.net  -  Please advise we're dead in the water.
fields.summary: BAM-16081 needs to be applied to our environment

fields.description:
we have same issue as BAM-16081 on SEN-2204186 xanadu


can you please help us?. or is there any fix currently
fields.summary: BAM-16081 having similer issue on demand

fields.description: When I hit https://ostusa.atlassian.net/builds/deploy/viewAllDeploymentProjects.action, all I get is a spinner where the page content should be. It never loads.

fields.summary: Internal server error when deleting a notification on a build plan

fields.description:
Both the build expiry and the "Orphaned Result Deletion Job" (a scheduled job
that runs every 120 seconds) perform very poorly on our large MySql Database. We have identified the culprit queries and managed to optimize those for mysql (See patch: [^speed_up_build_expiry_mysql.patch]).

Without the patch, queries like this one:
{code}delete from VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION where BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID in (
       select BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID from BUILDRESULTSUMMARY
       where BUILDRESULTSUMMARY.BUILD_KEY = "BAM-1");{code}
run over 120 Seconds, as they do a full table scan on VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION
(which is really large). To make things worse, the query locks
BUILTRESULTSUMMARY, so that queries that try to write to it run into the lock
timeout. With some optimizations to the database (anything that is suggested
[here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/MySQL+-+Lock+wait+timeout+exceeded+-+try+restarting+transaction], and more), we were able to mitigate this a bit, but the issue still persists.

The patch uses MySql specific "delete from join" syntax, but only if the database is MySql. Using this, the equivalent delete queries execute in under a second (as they are able to use the indices).

Also see [this question|http://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/104416/mysql-delete-where-in-vs-delete-from-join-and-locked-tables-on-delete] I asked on dba.stackexchange.com.
fields.summary: Cleanup jobs have insufficient performance on MySql

fields.description:
Bamboo UI is experiencing problems in the following sections: 

*Builds* section:
* "Show more plans" doesn't work
* Navigation Links keeps Loading
* Excessive never-ending errors are logged to the Chrome Console.

*Deployments* section:
* No Deployments are showing
* Navigation Links keep Loading

!dep-error.jpeg!

h2. Incident Progress:
JDK 8 has been rolled out to all Bamboo Cloud instances to resolve the problem. Please clear your cookies and cache if the problem is persisting. If you're still encountering issues then log a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com

h2. Other Problems related to this Upgrade with the same root cause:
[BAM-16080 - XSRF filter causing 500 error when triggering builds or changing filters in Bamboo 5.10-OD-01-004|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16080]
[BAM-16090 - The "Create a new plan" screen is broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16090]
[BAM-16092 - Triggers page seems to be broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16092]
[BAM-16093 - Option to run customized builds in Bamboo is taking to a broken page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16093]
fields.summary: Bamboo Builds and Deployments sections showing UI problems after upgrade

h2. Incident Progress:
JDK 8 has been rolled out to all Bamboo Cloud instances to resolve the problem. Please clear your cookies and cache if the problem is persisting. If you're still encountering issues then log a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com

h2. Other Problems related to this Upgrade with the same root cause:
[BAM-16081 - Bamboo Builds and Deployments sections showing UI problems after upgrade|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16081]
[BAM-16090 - The "Create a new plan" screen is broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16090]
[BAM-16092 - Triggers page seems to be broken|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16092]
[BAM-16093 - Option to run customized builds in Bamboo is taking to a broken page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16093]
fields.summary: XSRF filter causing 500 error when triggering builds or changing filters in Bamboo 5.10-OD-01-004

fields.description:
We're using gradle 2.4 support for native toolchains to do a C++ build on clang with GoogleTest set to output test results in xUnit format.

The xUnit format is processed correctly, but the artifactory gradle seems to have a hard-coded expectation for gradle to report test results.  

We were able to work around this by doing a script task that executed ./gradlew build instead of using the built-in artifactory task, but it took us a lot of debugging to determine that the issue was in the artifactory gradle task.
fields.summary: Artifactory Gradle task assumes test results will be produced

fields.description:
On Bamboo Cloud pricing tiers are based on agents (and jobs, but mostly agents), starting from 1 agent up to 1000. The more agents, the more processes can run concurrently – either steps in the same build, or different builds.
Regardless the number of agents selection on the customer's license, which on Cloud is controlled by our payment system integrated with Bamboo, if the customer sets a higher number of maximum number of elastic agents on the Elastic Bamboo configuration screen (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/builds/admin/elastic/editElasticConfig.action) and saves it, Bamboo's license details (https://<instance>.atlassian.net/builds/admin/updateLicense!default.action - only viewable by sysadmins on Cloud) is updated according to this number and allows more concurrent agents to be started than the actual license would allow.
For example, if the customer is on the first license tier, 1 job 1 agent, he can set the maximum number of elastic agents to 5 on the Elastic Bamboo configuration screen then start 5 instances/agents at once regardless of what his license tier allows which would be just 1.
fields.summary: License isn't enforced when it comes to remote agents on Bamboo Cloud

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to have a global permission that allows someone to have the following access without full admin rights to Bamboo:
* Manage Agents
* Run all plans
* Edit all plans
* Admin all plans
* Admin only - don't run builds

The only way to allow someone those permissions globally right now is to give them full admin access, which is not something we would like to do
Thanks,
Jeremy
fields.summary: More granular global permissions

fields.description:
If the remote ssh server refuses (as recommended) SHA-1, and only accepts SHA-256, the deployment task fails with:


{code:java}
26-Jun-2015 12:51:01	Starting task 'ssh' of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-scp-plugin:sshtask'
26-Jun-2015 12:51:01	Connecting to **** on port: ***
26-Jun-2015 12:51:01	Failed to connect to host
26-Jun-2015 12:51:01	net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportException: Unable to reach a settlement: [diffie-hellman-group14-sha1, diffie-hellman-group1-sha1] and [curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256]
26-Jun-2015 12:51:01	        at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Proposal.firstMatch(Proposal.java:145)
